answers.author: Vickie Atkinson
answers.text:
The City of Durham NC has an internal leadership training program that was developed internally and has been in operation (including earlier iterations) for more than 10 years. The program is based on the Center for Creative Leadership's model of assessment, challenge and support. Components include Skillscope 360 assessment, in class sessions, team applied learning projects, and optional business coaching. Many components are conducted by internal staff or volunteers.

answers.author: Tom Richardson
answers.text:
The main benefits of using internal resources are localized expertise and, probably, cost savings. However, depending on the goals of the program, external folks can often bring perspectives that wouldn't otherwise be considered. If cost is an issue perhaps a leader from another jurisdiction could be "borrowed" or "swapped". I've attached info on a program that used this blended approach, weighted more toward the external.
